sentences.en: "Ah, Captain Fox," Martin McGuinness said affably. "Nice to see you again."
sentences.cn: “啊，福克斯上尉，”马丁·麦吉尼斯亲切地说，“很高兴再次见到您。”

sentences.en: a fox with its leg in a trap
Britain has the largest and most flourishing fox population in Europe.
sentences.cn: 英国拥有欧洲最大也是最具繁殖能力的狐狸种群。

sentences.en: By 1920, Fox and Universal were already names to conjure with.
sentences.cn: 到1920年，福克斯和环球已经声名显赫。

sentences.en: Enrico was too good, an old fox, cunning.
sentences.cn: 恩里科很有心计，是一只狡猾的老狐狸。

sentences.en: Even from a distance the effect of his fox costume was stunning.
sentences.cn: 即使从远处看，他的狐狸戏服也很抢眼。

sentences.en: Fox stepped forward, welcomed him in Malay, and presented him to Jack.
sentences.cn: 福克斯走向前，用马来语向他表示欢迎，并把他介绍给了杰克。

sentences.en: Fox, badger, weasel and stoat are regularly seen here.
sentences.cn: 狐狸、獾、黄鼠狼和白鼬在这里很常见。

sentences.en: He led the way to the lift. Fox played along, following him.
sentences.cn: 他朝电梯走去，福克斯只得紧随其后。

sentences.en: He was a sly old fox.
He was as cunning as a fox.

sentences.cn: 他是个诡计多端的老狐狸。

sentences.en: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.
sentences.cn: 画面中一只狐狸正被一群猎狗撕咬得肠子外流。

sentences.en: James Fox is best known as the author of White Mischief.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯·福克斯以《欲望城》一书最为出名.

sentences.en: On farms the fox is considered vermin and treated as such.
sentences.cn: 在农场里狐狸被当成有害动物来对待。

sentences.en: She worked at 20th Century Fox as a film editor.
sentences.cn: 她在20世纪福克斯公司担任电影剪辑师。

sentences.en: The clever fox escaped the hunter.
sentences.cn: 伶俐的狐狸逃过了猎人的追捕。

sentences.en: We were foxed by the problem.
sentences.cn: 我们被这个问题难住了。

words.tran_cn: 狡猾的；赤褐色的；如狐的

phrases.tran_cn: （美）红狐狸；赤狐（体型最大、最常见的狐狸）；赤狐毛皮

trans.tran_en: a wild animal like a dog with reddish-brown fur, a pointed face, and a thick tail
to confuse or deceive someone in a clever way
